Posts.Content: My Mum was an identical twin and one of 5 sisters. 3 of them had breast cancer,  including her twin . Im one of 3 sisters and the 2nd to have breast cancer.  That's 2 thirds. I have 2 daughters and 5 grandaughter's.  I hate that they are at risk.xx
Posts.Title: how many people have had sisters who have also had BC

Posts.Content: Thanks Helen for replying.  Yes, Im convinced myself its lymphedema and annoyed that cancer is yet again trying to laugh at me. Damn it !!! Im praying that the swelling in my neck is nothing to worry about but concerned as it has  got worse since November .  I will put up a post after Ive had my appointment.  Thankyou again..xx
Posts.Title: Lymphedema 2yrs on and possible recurrence

Posts.Content: Hi Julia,  had to go bad to my gp today as it was so red and painful  in elbow joint. Doc said,  yes looks like  lymphedema and I,ll need a glove and sleeve fitted at the lymphedema clinic. The hospital will arrange this on Monday 23rd.  He said infection  is bad and gave me 500mg of fluxloxicillin x4 daily and phenoxymethilpenicillin 500mg x4 daily. If it gets worse  before  Monday  Ive to go to A&E as might need intravenous antibiotics.  The swelling on my neck is about 3 by 4 cm in size bigger than  Im comfortable  with...thanks for replying my heads all over the place. On a good note my xray results showed I havnt re broken wher  my rib was surgically # so thats good..xx
Posts.Title: Lymphedema 2yrs on and possible recurrence

Posts.Content: I had bilateral mastectomy with reconstruction done Oct 2014. 2cm IDC, no chemo and no radiotherapy as breasts were being removed they said . 5 lymph nodes removed.  Ive recently had swelling of the hand and lower forearm which went down in 2 days but now have swelling on upper forearm and just above my elbow with painful hard red areas.  *** Does this sound like lymphedema?  *** I contacted my breast care nurse before the redness came and she has got me an apt for next Monday 23rd Jan. This is also to check out a swelling just above my left coller bone which was found in Nov at yearly review but was told only to contact them if it persisted or got bigger, ( which it has ) .  My cancer was on my right breast as is the swelling in my arm and neck swelling on the left as was my sister's.  Im really worried as my sister didnt make it after her neck lymphs were involved as it rapidly spread everywhere. Any help or info on this would really be helpful. No sugar coating plz...xx
Posts.Title: Lymphedema 2yrs on and possible recurrence

Posts.Content: Can I ask how long you waited from docs referral to seeing a consultant. It's bee2 and a half weeks for me and no word. Lump is bigger and now have discharge from the nipple.
Posts.Title: Do docs play down cancer until they get biopsy results or can they...

Posts.Content: Antibiotics can cause thrush so best treatment is an oral get which works quickly. Its orange flavoured so quite pleasant to use. Maybe give it a try, it can be bought over the counter at any chemist. X
Posts.Title: Do i need antibiotics

Posts.Content: I get my pathology results on Tuesday to determine treatment but already discussed double mastectomy and see the plastic surgeon on the 17th March. I am currently a DD cup ( minus missing piece from right boob ) and have conflicting expectations of reconstruction from two different consultants. One says will probably be diep flap other says won't be as I have mild angina and too long an op. Anyone had a double mx done who can offer help or advice on ANY matter that can help. Xx
Posts.Title: Anyone had double mastectomy with reconstruction ??

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone. I am having trouble deciding what to do. But as was said, no point in great new blobs if I'm dead. Don't know if surgeon doing my op knows about the angina as she,s never asked me but has seen my notes. Further investigation needed about heart prob before I decide. Thanks for your input. Probably go for implants to be on safe side though. Xx
Posts.Title: Anyone had double mastectomy with reconstruction ??

Posts.Content: Hope all goes well today. I,d just posted the same question as having bilateral mastectomy and diep on the 23rd Oct.  Take care , will be thinking of you. Will look forward to your post op posts. ♡♡♡
Posts.Title: Pre-op advice

Posts.Content: Im not at the stage of reconstruction yet so can only suggest you call your breast care nurse or even the macmillan helpline . I hope somone can help you soon. X
Posts.Title: Back Pain

Posts.Content: Got results. Grade 2 with no lymph node involvement, so no chemo. Was originally told I would have radiotherapy before double mastectomy but now say no. This was because plastic surgeon had date the end of April. However my bmi is 34 and I need it down so op May be delayed so don't know where I am regards rads now. X
Posts.Title: pathology report after WLE and SLNB today

Posts.Content: Feeling a tad anxious now as I will know what I'm dealing with now. Also anxious about treatment options, as I've said before, I want everything AND the kitchen sink. Don't think I,'ll be comfortable otherwise. Sounds daft I know as it would have to be bad enough for them to suggest this and I don't want it to be bad enough.......SEE......said it sounds daft. I know I have to have double mastectomy and reconstruction in few months and inhibitors ( er+ & pr+ ) but what else I don't know. X
Posts.Title: pathology report after WLE and SLNB today

Posts.Content: Thanks for replying to my post. Not been on as had internet problems.  I didnt get rads as doing mastectomy and grade 2 so they said no chemo needed. I see Mr McKay again on Monday. This was arranged by clinical phycologist Yvonne Mc Neil who is lovely and VERY helpful.  Apt is to answer questions about my op which my initial hospital should have covered but didnt. Will let you know how I get on. Good to know he airs on the side of caution as I heamouraged badly during previous ops and this has been a concern. Xx
Posts.Title: Mr McKay, Glasgow Royal. anyone seen him ?

Posts.Content: My plastic surgeon is Mr McKay at the Glasgow Royal . Anyone else had him for diep flap reconstruction and if so could share experiences.  My op is on 23rd October and nobody so far has seen me to explain anything like, what I need, how many drains (  Bilateral mastectomy ). Been told I, ll be in hospital 7 day's and that so far is all I know. Will I get more info at pre op assessment ? X
Posts.Title: Mr McKay, Glasgow Royal. anyone seen him ?

Posts.Content: Sorry that you have once again been thrown in the ring. Difficult to comprehend what,s going through your mind right now. Don't think " Wait and see " would do for me. I have my lumpectomy on Thursday 27th with lamb. I have very strong family history including my sister so my reaction was " I want them off " . Due to waiting list for double mx and recon , I am having this op done first then big one in a few months. I have invasive ductal carcinoma. Having it turn up in other breast before final op is my worst fear. I can't say what you should do but I sincerely wish you well . Take care....x
Posts.Title: Anybody in the same position?

Posts.Content: Sorry...predictive txt....slnb....not Lamb....( hate this Kindle Sometimes ) x
Posts.Title: Anybody in the same position?

Posts.Content: Hi, Im 57 and on Tamoxifen since April this year. I was diagnosed with osteoporosis of the spine at age 43 which was a shock. Found osteopenia in hips and feet and hands 2 yrs ago. As I had a hysterectomy 14yrs ago I should have gone on to letrazole but it was decided 2yrs on tamoxifen first then at least 3yrs on letrazole as the combination of both like this will give me a better survival rate according to my consultant. I take alendronic acid tab 70mg one morning a week and 2 adcal d3 lozenges a day. The prospect of broken bones worry me but cancer scares the shit out me as have lost too many family members to this ugly disease. So its a no brainer for me.......keep taking the tablets.........fight like a girl... Chin up and keep strong YOU CAN DO THIS.....HONESTLY..XX
Posts.Title: stopping tamoxifen..breast cancer

Posts.Content: Does anyone know if having a higher hormone receptor reading makes it more aggressive ? It was something a consultant said that made me think it is. Mine is ER 8. PR 8.
Posts.Title: ER8. PR8

Posts.Content: Hope so. Thanks for your replies. Xx
Posts.Title: ER8. PR8

Posts.Content: Yes, I know the higher number means the cancer is more receptive to these hormones. But does it make them harder to treat. ? Does it make it more aggressive? It's just that I saw a private consultant last week who said I should have an MRI due to the fact my cancer was highly hormone receptive and family history. .....it left me thinking.
Posts.Title: ER8. PR8

Posts.Content: Yes, fn your breast care nurse if possible. If not call your docs secretary explaing whats going on. They should pass it on and get u seen again. Hope you get help soon. Xx
Posts.Title: quite worried

Posts.Content: Yes, I would love the recipe. If that's ok. Xx
Posts.Title: Strange sensation

Posts.Content: I agree. I've seen wle, snd, fec, ft etc. Really confusing. Xx
Posts.Title: Abbreviations

Posts.Content: Thanks Julia.  Im usually a very positive person and ALWAYS  have my" fight it " head on.  I think Im more stressed as I "saw " the changes on screen,  him measureing them and then taking pictures for the consultant .  It is also where my sisters came back and she passed 5 months later after it spread everywhere.  I keep telling  my head to " shut up"......but its not working.  I usually meditate as Im a therapist  but that worm in my ear just keeps invading my thoughts.  Thanks for letting me rant on..Mary..x
Posts.Title: Ultrasound. ...it might be back !!!

Posts.Content: Well had the ultrasound of my neck today ( CT is now on the 13th ) . Sonographer said " A few of your Lymph Nodes have changes on them " He asked when CT was and said that it was good it was soon as then doctor can decide what to do.  Im freaking out. Still not told anyone except my husband who left on Tuesday for 3wks offshore.  Said the breast clinic will get the results but may wait until  CT done before  calling me in as they would  have a clearer picture. Now all this was said without ACTUALLY saying, the cancer is back but Im aware its not his place to say.  Im trying to stay positive but its hard. I don't know if I can  bare the look on my children, s faces again or hear them cry.  Sorry if Im rambling or not making sense but I can't think straight.....Aaargh.....
Posts.Title: Ultrasound. ...it might be back !!!

Posts.Content: I am just going in to day 4 after op and feel not too bad, just a bit sore and tired. Had to remove a larger than expected area as skin was tethered between lump and previous scar. When I agreed to lumpectomy while waiting on mastectomy and reconstruction my consultant said I would definitely be having radiotherapy and possibly chemo if pathology warranted it. But just before op she said if having mastectomy then MIGHT get away without doing rads. Now this may seem crazy to some but I WANT rads AND chemo. I don't want to take any chances of this spreading ( invasive ductal carcinoma ) . My sister only got a year after diagnosis and she HAD all these treatments and hormone therapy so can't help thinking I need them too to put up a fight. I know it depends on grade, stage ,size, and node involvement but I can't help how I feel. I want to throw everything at it. I don't care about losing my hair or feeling like carp. Am I wrong to feel like this.
Posts.Title: Had WLE and SLNB on Thursday 27th. Get pathology results on 11th March...

Posts.Content: Was it today u had it op for clearer margin ? If so I hope all went well. I don't know grade or stage till pathology results r back on Tuesday the 11th. I am to have a double mastectomy with reconstruction in a few months. So not looking forward to that as both arms will be affected. Hope your infection clears soon so u can start the fight with chemo. X
Posts.Title: Had WLE and SLNB on Thursday 27th. Get pathology results on 11th March...

Posts.Content: Yes, I have REpos and PRpos. Am I right in saying u have her/2 as on herceptin? It's my worst fear it returning. It must have bean a terrible shock for you. How r u coping with everything. Do you have a Maggie,s centre or anything similar nearby. We have a Maggie,s about 10 mins from where I live although they r moving early summer to a new building further away. Only been once just before my op but will be going on Thursday to a relaxation class and Fri to meditation . I really hope everything goes well for you, I really do. Xx
Posts.Title: Had WLE and SLNB on Thursday 27th. Get pathology results on 11th March...

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone for ur advice. I do know there are more side effects to chemo than losing my hair. I have read up on here and breast cancer care a lot of info. I know too that radiotherapy isnt a breeze either but if it kicks its butt then fine. I watched my sister go through a terrible year before she passed it had spread everywhere and I want a fighting chance. A terrible family history as gran had 5 girls of which 3 had breast cancer including mum,s identical twin and my mum had 3 girls , 2 out of 3 with breast cancer. I worry for myself my daughters and 5 granddaughter's ( so far ) . When will this end?
Posts.Title: Had WLE and SLNB on Thursday 27th. Get pathology results on 11th March...

Posts.Content: I was dx on Tuesday with DCIS. Due to size I had 2nd biopsy from different points surrounding the tumour as might have outgrown the duct. Didn't tell my husband till day before and my kids don't know yet. My husband and eldest son are offshore and didn't want to worry them as not safe out there. All mixed up with info.
Posts.Title: newly diagnosed with DCIS queery invasive

Posts.Content: My children are 36, 34, 28 and 19. My grandchildren are 15,13,11,6,5,5,5,and 18months 8 in total. I'm also worried that my daughter's will be terrified for there future as my mum,s identical twin and 2 other sisters plus my sister all had breast Cancer and now me. I also have 5 granddaughters. I am 56 . My sister was diagnosed at 48 . Yes really difficult. Like a lot of us they all have other worries and now I'm adding to them......hate this. Xx
Posts.Title: newly diagnosed with DCIS queery invasive

Posts.Content: Thanks Dorithee. I have told my husband as he knew I was going for results although as I said I only told him the day before about the biopsy etc. It's my eldest son I need home before I tell him and my 3 other children. He should have been home today but freezing conditions made it impossible. My husband is a radio op so not on rig floor much. My son on the other hand works with the drillers so needs his mind on the job and not me for his safety and for the safety of others. I have confided in a few good friends as I would be a basket case by now if I didn't. It's so difficult looking into my children's faces and keeping this from them but I have to tell them all together. Thanks for being so kind and replying. Xx
Posts.Title: newly diagnosed with DCIS queery invasive
